metadata.bijbeltekst: Mark 15:29-34 (The Passion According to St. Mark)

kernfrasen: There is no passage from Palm Sunday to Easter without Good Friday
Jesus of Nazareth goes his solitary way
follow him then, this week, to the foot of his Cross
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITH IS A JOURNEY THROUGH SUFFERING

kernfrasen: one of the greatest weapons against evil is subversive humor
gives him strength to do battle with apartheid
deliver his children from the unspeakable fate
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: GOD IS A FATHER WHO SUFFERS WITH HIS CHILDREN

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The cosmic scale has been conclusively tipped in the opposite direction

mapping_structuur.doel_element: The decisive act of the Crucifixion

cognitieve_implicaties: The universe has an inherent moral equilibrium that was broken and is now fixed.
theologische_implicaties: God's intervention is objective and structural, not just emotional.
ethische_implicaties: Believers can act with hope because the 'weight' of history has already shifted.
onbedoelde_consequenties: May suggest a mechanistic view of salvation where human agency is irrelevant.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'justice' scale by applying it to the 'cosmic' level of suffering and global politics.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon maintains a tight tension between the 'Old World' (violence/suffering) and the 'New World' (the Cross). The metaphors of journey and battle are unified by the central image of the 'Cry of Dereliction'.

incoherentie_punten.metafoor_b: Jesus as cosmic victor (New World Order)
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The transition from the 'solitary way' of a dying man to the 'New World Order' of a King is abrupt.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: A solitary, abandoned death usually entails defeat, whereas a 'New World Order' entails administrative or military power.

succesvolle_blending.locatie: The story of the KKK and the Sunday clothes
succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Subversion: The 'weapon' is redefined as 'applause' and 'joy', blending the domain of warfare with the domain of worship.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the dead metaphor of 'The New World Order' (political) by mapping it onto the 'Kingdom of God' (theological).
sterktes.voorbeeld: May I take your New World Order?

risicos.beschrijving: The use of 'New World Order'—a phrase with heavy political and conspiratorial baggage—might be misunderstood as a literal political program.
risicos.voorbeeld: The claim of the Christian gospel is that the Crucifixion of Jesus was the inauguration of the New World Order.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation might focus on geopolitical shifts rather than internal/spiritual transformation.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A courtroom/newsroom where the 'headlines' of the world are being judged against the 'headline' of the Cross.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective; it forces the hearer to see the ancient text as the 'real' news.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By emphasizing the 'Cry of Dereliction' as God's own cry.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Contrasting the 'party' atmosphere with the 'funeral' reality of the Passion.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligned with the Episcopal/Lutheran 'Sunday of the Passion' liturgy.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the JOURNEY and CONFLICT domains. It successfully uses the 'New World Order' as a bridge between secular anxiety and theological hope. The preacher avoids the 'Economic' domain (debt/payment), focusing instead on 'Presence' and 'Identification' (Relational domain).

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the source domain by emphasizing the 'abandoned child' aspect to match the 'Cry of Dereliction'.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The Son is not just a title; it is the cry of a child who expects a Father's hand and finds only nails.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The shift from 'catastrophe' to 'New World Order'.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Seed' metaphor (Agrarian) to show how the 'catastrophe' of the buried seed is the 'order' of the coming harvest.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If the scale is 'tipped', why does the world look the same?
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Clarify that the scale has tipped in the 'heavenly court' or 'deep reality', while the 'surface' still ripples with the old order.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To support the 'New World Order' concept with the idea of a 'New Foundation' being laid under the old ruins.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: The Church's role in the world

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in using a contemporary political metaphor to unlock an ancient liturgical text, successfully disrupting the 'complacency schema' of the hearer.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'vivid imagery' of the blood-written note, CMT reveals that this note functions as a 'Source Domain' for understanding the 'Target' of Jesus' own cry.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on the 'story' as a whole, CMT identifies the specific cognitive mappings (e.g., MORAL COURAGE IS SUNDAY CLOTHES) that make the stories persuasive.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT highlights how the preacher uses 'Verticality' (descend from the cross) to show that God's 'New Order' actually functions through 'Horizontal' identification (staying on the cross).

volledige_metafoor_lijst: inauguration of the New World Order
heart, center, guts of its claim
steady vision of the heavenly city
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the contrast between 'seeing' and 'reality', a common cognitive frame in Johannine and Pauline theology.
